physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in chronological order from the front to the back of the file. Circled serial numbers (red for received correspondence; blue/black for issued correspondence) refer to entries in the notes at the rear of the file.

Foliation: the foliation system in use starts on the first typescript page, which is numbered 1, and runs through to number 6, which is the last typescript page. The foliation sequence is written in pencil in the top right hand corner of each folio.

mods.abstract: Correspondence between the Government of India, the office of the Political Resident, Persian Gulf, the Political Agent, Bahrain, and the Adviser to the Bahrain Government (Charles Dalrymple Belgrave) relating to the decision to allow Captain G L Mallam special pay of 200 rupees per month for the fixed period 26 March to 2 May 1926, while he was serving as Assistant Political Agent, Bahrain. It was a condition that the payment should be made by the Bahrain state, and this was agreed.
